abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Enterprise Sector
            Rationalization and Privatization Technical Assistance
            Project (PATSEP) will consist of two components: (a) support
            to the second divestiture program; and (b) support to the
            Government's public enterprise (PE) sector management.
            Activities under the first component will be designed to
            help the Government formulate and implement the second
            divestiture program covering some 46 PEs.  They include: 1)
            the services of a privatization expert; 2) consulting
            services for the privatization or liquidation of specific
            PEs; 3) advisory services on the legal reform program with a
            view to fostering private sector development; and (4) the
            services of two experts, one internationally and one
            nationally recruited, to help the Government and the
            targeted PEs develop the reorientation programs for
            redundant PE employees. The second component aims at
            reinforcing the Government's capacity to manage a
            streamlined PE sector, in particular, to apply more rigorous
            financial control and discipline.  Activities under this
            component include the services of: 1) a PE reform expert; 2)
            a legal advisor to assist with legal reform; 3) a financial
            expert to restore financial discipline in the sector; 4) a
            management information expert to help with the development
            of a management information system; 5) an expert to help
            develop a regulatory framework to the public utilities; 6)
            studies of additional reform measures; 7) Government agency
            staff training; and 8) logistic support.
